markdown:
The loquacious proteans known as imenteshes serve as missionaries, spies, and heralds of chaos to further the protean goal of reality's dissolution. Imenteshes are cunning, curiously diplomatic, and profoundly whimsical. They travel beyond the [Maelstrom](/Planes.aspx?ID=19) for their work, frequently adopting extravagant personal attire and decorations that often border upon the garish, all to curry favor with less chaotic beings. **[Recall Knowledge - Monitor](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 27 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 25 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 22 [Imentesh](/Monsters.aspx?ID=766) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 207 2.0 **Perception** +19; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), entropy sense (imprecise) 60 feet **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Protean](/Languages.aspx?ID=33); [_tongues_](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +17, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +19, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +21, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +19, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) +21, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +21, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +17 **Str** +7 **Dex** +5 **Con** +5 **Int** +7 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +5 **Entropy Sense** ([divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [prediction](/Traits.aspx?ID=132)) An imentesh can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the imentesh the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of [_nondetection_](/Spells.aspx?ID=209) or that is otherwise shielded from [divinations](/Traits.aspx?ID=47) and [predictions](/Traits.aspx?ID=132) cannot be noticed via entropy sense. --- **AC** 30 **Fort** +21 **Ref** +19 **Will** +17 +1 status to all saves vs. magic **HP** 175 ([fast healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15) 5) **Resistances** precision 10, protean anatomy 15 **Weaknesses** lawful 10 **Protean Anatomy** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) An imentesh's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the imentesh takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.
The imentesh is immune to [polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127) effects unless it is a willing target. If [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) or [deafened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=8), the imentesh automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones. --- **Speed** 25 feet, fly 25 feet, swim 25 feet; [_freedom of movement_](/Spells.aspx?ID=128) **Melee** jaws +23 ([Chaotic](/Traits.aspx?ID=25), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d10+11 piercing plus 1d6 chaotic and warpwave strike **Melee** claw +23 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Chaotic](/Traits.aspx?ID=25), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d6+11 slashing plus 1d6 chaotic **Melee** tail +23 ([Chaotic](/Traits.aspx?ID=25), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d10+11 bludgeoning plus 1d6 chaotic and [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Divine Innate Spells** DC 29 - **1st** [Detect Alignment](/Spells.aspx?ID=65) (at will; lawful only) - **3rd** [Haste](/Spells.aspx?ID=147), [Mending](/Spells.aspx?ID=189), [Shrink Item](/Spells.aspx?ID=285), [Slow](/Spells.aspx?ID=289) - **4th** [Creation](/Spells.aspx?ID=54), [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) (at will), [Shatter](/Spells.aspx?ID=279) - **5th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69), [Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=78), [Divine Wrath](/Spells.aspx?ID=86) (chaotic), [Sending](/Spells.aspx?ID=272) - **Constant (4th)** [Freedom of Movement](/Spells.aspx?ID=128) - **Constant (5th)** [Tongues](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=8)** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) The imentesh takes the appearance of any Large or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal. **[Constrict](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=10)** 1d10+11 bludgeoning, DC 29 **Inflict Warpwave** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) An imentesh inflicts a warpwave on a creature within 100 feet (see Warpwave below; DC 29 Fortitude save to resist). **[Sneak Attack](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=34)** An imentesh's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) targets. **Warpwave Strike** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) Any creature struck and damaged by an imentesh's jaws Strike must succeed at a DC 29 Fortitude save or be subject to a warpwave.
Mouthpieces of Chaos While rarely found on the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1), imenteshes frequent interplanar hubs of culture and commerce. Imenteshes act as diplomats on behalf of any chorus they claim allegiance to. They can offer safe travel through the [Maelstrom](/Planes.aspx?ID=19) or even act as guides through the Maelstrom's ever-shifting Borderlands.
name: Imentesh

Imenteshes are cunning, curiously diplomatic, and profoundly whimsical. They travel beyond the Maelstrom for their work, frequently adopting extravagant personal attire and decorations that often border upon the garish, all to curry favor with less chaotic beings. This grants the imentesh the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. Immediately after the imentesh takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The imentesh is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If blinded or deafened, the imentesh automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones. --- Speed 25 feet, fly 25 feet, swim 25 feet; freedom of movement Melee Single Action jaws +23 (Chaotic, Magical, reach 10 feet), Damage 2d10+11 piercing plus 1d6 chaotic and warpwave strike Melee Single Action claw +23 (Agile, Chaotic, Magical, reach 10 feet), Damage 2d6+11 slashing plus 1d6 chaotic Melee Single Action tail +23 (Chaotic, Magical, reach 15 feet), Damage 2d10+11 bludgeoning plus 1d6 chaotic and Grab Divine Innate Spells DC 29 - 1st Detect Alignment (at will; lawful only) - 3rd Haste, Mending, Shrink Item, Slow - 4th Creation, Dimension Door (at will), Shatter - 5th Dimension Door, Dispel Magic, Divine Wrath (chaotic), Sending - Constant (4th) Freedom of Movement - Constant (5th) Tongues Change Shape Single Action (Concentrate, Divine, Polymorph, Transmutation) The imentesh takes the appearance of any Large or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal. Sneak Attack An imentesh's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed targets. Warpwave Strike (Divine, Transmutation) Any creature struck and damaged by an imentesh's jaws Strike must succeed at a DC 29 Fortitude save or be subject to a warpwave. Mouthpieces of Chaos While rarely found on the Material Plane, imenteshes frequent interplanar hubs of culture and commerce. Imenteshes act as diplomats on behalf of any chorus they claim allegiance to. They can offer safe travel through the Maelstrom or even act as guides through the Maelstrom's ever-shifting Borderlands.
